How can I participate in stock markets ?
How can I participate in stock markets ?


To participate in{" "} {" "} stock market {" "} in India one needs a PAN or an Aadhar Card for KYC procedure while opening an account with the market regulator, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI), the government has also mandated six-month bank statement along with a cancelled cheque, under the new rules to open a demat account.

Since, you cannot directly place the orders so you need to appoint a broker with help of whom you can place orders. There are many brokers available you can get in touch with. After knowing their terms and conditions, their fees and advisory performance and all you can select one according to your preference.

After selecting a suitable broker you can open a demat account with them, which will hold the stocks you buy in your name. Since, the shares can’t be held in physical form they form the part of dematerialised account ( demat). To open a demat account you can also connect with us{" "} kuants , as we work as a sub-broker with Motilal Oswal Securities Ltd. (MOSL).

After opening a demat account you can place all your orders to buy or sell different market instruments. There are various kinds of orders and limits you can put to your orders. You need to specify quantity, stock, price for the particular security for putting the order, and you need to quick and accurate as the prices change 10 times in a sec.

So, the advantage that you get at our platform is that you can automate your trades with our software, that will execute all your trades. We will tell you more about it in the upcoming videos. Once all this is done you are ready to enter the market. But before you enter the market there are few things you need to think about.

From the previous videos you must have got a brief understanding of the markets and the different instruments present in it. You can get a more in depth understanding by reading various books or searching online through various materials available. Once, you get the feeling that you have the idea about how market works, how stock prices fluctuate, the various socioeconomic factors that affect the market you should start.

To begin, you should first decide your goal depending on your future and current needs, funds you can invest and a broad idea about the time for which you want to invest. Depending on your goals you should begin developing your{" "} investmet strategy . Also, when you enter the market try to understand your timing of entrance, if the stocks are at their all time high/low and various other factors and should wait for the optimum conditions for entering the market.

After entering the market you should always carefully manage and monitor your portfolio. If a stock has fallen below a certain level, which you can decide, say for example 10%, you should immediately sell it before facing further losses. Also, don’t keep all the eggs in the same basket and try to diversify your investment to minimize the risk. Say for example if you invest only in auto stocks and the auto industry faces some slowdown due to may be say some government policy or something, your portfolio will be facing losses. Instead you can diversify by maybe investing in different sectors, which might be gaining profit at that time. So, this way you can reduce your losses. And this shows the importance of diversification.
